body:
```
gcc -v                                                                                                                                                                                                        1   master 
Using built-in specs.
COLLECT_GCC=gcc
COLLECT_LTO_WRAPPER=/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/7.2.1/lto-wrapper
Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
Configured with: /build/gcc/src/gcc/configure --prefix=/usr --libdir=/usr/lib --libexecdir=/usr/lib --mandir=/usr/share/man --infodir=/usr/share/info --with-bugurl=https://bugs.archlinux.org/ --enable-languages=c,c++,ada,fortran,go,lto,objc,obj-c++ --enable-shared --enable-threads=posix --enable-libmpx --with-system-zlib --with-isl --enable-__cxa_atexit --disable-libunwind-exceptions --enable-clocale=gnu --disable-libstdcxx-pch --disable-libssp --enable-gnu-unique-object --enable-linker-build-id --enable-lto --enable-plugin --enable-install-libiberty --with-linker-hash-style=gnu --enable-gnu-indirect-function --enable-multilib --disable-werror --enable-checking=release --enable-default-pie --enable-default-ssp
Thread model: posix
gcc version 7.2.1 20180116 (GCC)
```

@elmindreda, I would recommend reverting 8dab9f6 in order to fix the second part.

I will also add `-Werror` to our CI in order to catch that kind of bug in the future, thanks for the testing!

issue.body:

Fixes #1197

Prevents #1197 from happening again.

body: @linkmauve Is it okay if I do it with 43801d1c736c2e4837f88270472b90ffad62af31 rebased?
I still find it a lot less explicit than the `assert(0)` way, but sure. :)
@linkmauve True. What about 53b193a16173ab989ce49006dc75c4c9f7f88946? It keeps the flow control and the explicit assert.
